abstract: The Deal Professor examines the likely next steps in the takeover battle between Airgas and Air Products and Chemicals after Airgas lost a shareholder vote to its hostile suitor.
snippet: The Deal Professor examines the likely next steps in the takeover battle between Airgas and Air Products and Chemicals after Airgas lost a shareholder vote to its hostile suitor.
lead_paragraph: 3:40 p.m. | Updated Airgas lost an important battle in the takeover war on Wednesday as its hostile suitor, Air Products and Chemicals, elected three directors to its board at the company’s annual meeting. In addition, Air Products’ proposal to amend the Airgas bylaws to move the company’s next annual meeting date to Jan. 18 was supported by most of the shareholder votes.

headline.main: After Losing Vote, What’s Next for Airgas?
